The proposed transportation tax plan inc: 200 annual fee for electric vehicle owners and eliminates a $5,000 state tax credit for all-electric vehicles.
The House has passed HB 170: which aims to raise approximately $700 million towards a $1 billion annual need for maintaining existing roads and bridges.
The tax credit for all: electric vehicles cost the state $13.6 million in 2013 and eliminating it, along with adding the annual fee, is estimated to generate about $68 million in new revenue in 2016.
